verses.verse: "But now <S%H6258><s%> those <S%H6810><s%> younger <S%H6810><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> I mock <S%H7832><s%> me, Whose <S%H834><s%> fathers I disdained <S%H1><s%> to put <S%H3988><s%> with the dogs <S%H7896><s%> of my flock. <S%H3611><s%>
"Indeed, <S%H1571><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> [good was] the strength <S%H3581><s%> of their hands <S%H3027><s%> to me? Vigor <S%H3624><s%> had perished from them.

"From want <S%H2639><s%> and famine <S%H3720><s%> they are gaunt <S%H1565><s%> Who gnaw <S%H6207><s%> the dry <S%H6723><s%> ground by night <S%H570><s%> in waste <S%H9585><s%> and desolation, <S%H4875><s%>
Who pluck <S%H6998><s%> mallow <S%H4408><s%> by the bushes, <S%H7880><s%> And whose food <S%H3899><s%> is the root <S%H8328><s%> of the broom <S%H7574><s%> shrub. <S%H7574><s%>
"They are driven <S%H1644><s%> from the community; <S%H9073><s%> They shout <S%H7321><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them as [against] a thief, <S%H1590><s%>
So that they dwell <S%H7931><s%> in dreadful <S%H6178><s%> valleys, <S%H5158><s%> In holes <S%H2356><s%> of the earth <S%H6083><s%> and of the rocks. <S%H3710><s%>
"Among <S%H996><s%> the bushes <S%H7880><s%> they cry <S%H5101><s%> out; Under <S%H8478><s%> the nettles <S%H2738><s%> they are gathered <S%H5596><s%> together. <S%H5596><s%>
"Fools, <S%H1121><s%> <S%H5036><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> those <S%H1121><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> a name, <S%H8034><s%> They were scourged <S%H5217><s%> from the land. <S%H776><s%>
"And now <S%H6258><s%> I have become <S%H1961><s%> their taunt, <S%H5058><s%> I have even become <S%H1961><s%> a byword <S%H4405><s%> to them.
"They abhor <S%H8581><s%> me [and] stand <S%H7368><s%> aloof <S%H7368><s%> from me, And they do not refrain <S%H2820><s%> from spitting <S%H7536><s%> at my face. <S%H6440><s%>

"Because <S%H3588><s%> He has loosed <S%H6605><s%> His bowstring <S%H9199><s%> and afflicted <S%H6031><s%> me, They have cast <S%H7971><s%> off <S%H7971><s%> the bridle <S%H7448><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> me.

"On the right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> their brood <S%H6526><s%> arises; <S%H6965><s%> They thrust <S%H7971><s%> aside my feet <S%H7272><s%> and build <S%H5549><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> me their ways <S%H734><s%> of destruction. <S%H343><s%>
"They break <S%H5420><s%> up my path, <S%H9350><s%> They profit <S%H3276><s%> from my destruction, <S%H1942><s%> No <S%H3808><s%> one restrains <S%H5826><s%> them.
"As [through] a wide <S%H7342><s%> breach <S%H6556><s%> they come, <S%H857><s%> Amid <S%H8478><s%> the tempest <S%H9585><s%> they roll <S%H1556><s%> on.

"Terrors <S%H1091><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me, They pursue <S%H7291><s%> my honor <S%H5082><s%> as the wind, <S%H7307><s%> And my prosperity <S%H3444><s%> has passed <S%H5674><s%> away <S%H5674><s%> like a cloud. <S%H5645><s%>
"And now <S%H6258><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> is poured <S%H8210><s%> out within <S%H5921><s%> me; Days <S%H3117><s%> of affliction <S%H6040><s%> have seized <S%H270><s%> me.

"At night <S%H3915><s%> it pierces <S%H5365><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> within <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me, And my gnawing <S%H6207><s%> [pains] take <S%H7901><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> rest. <S%H7901><s%>
"By a great <S%H7230><s%> force <S%H3581><s%> my garment <S%H3830><s%> is distorted; <S%H2664><s%> It binds <S%H247><s%> me about as the collar <S%H6310><s%> of my coat. <S%H3801><s%>
"He has cast <S%H3384><s%> me into the mire, <S%H2563><s%> And I have become <S%H4911><s%> like <S%H4911><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes. <S%H665><s%>
"I cry <S%H7768><s%> out to Thee for help, <S%H7768><s%> but Thou dost not answer <S%H6030><s%> me; I stand <S%H5975><s%> up, and Thou dost turn <S%H995><s%> Thy attention <S%H995><s%> against me.
"Thou hast become <S%H2015><s%> cruel <S%H393><s%> to me; With the might <S%H6108><s%> of Thy hand <S%H3027><s%> Thou dost persecute <S%H7852><s%> me.
"Thou dost lift <S%H5375><s%> me up to the wind <S%H7307><s%> [and] cause me to ride; <S%H7392><s%> And Thou dost dissolve <S%H4127><s%> me in a storm. <S%H8663><s%>
"For I know <S%H3045><s%> that Thou wilt bring <S%H7725><s%> me to death <S%H4194><s%> And to the house <S%H1004><s%> of meeting <S%H4150><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> living. <S%H2416><s%>

"Yet <S%H389><s%> does not one in a heap <S%H5856><s%> of ruins <S%H5856><s%> stretch <S%H7971><s%> out [his] hand, <S%H3027><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> in his disaster <S%H6365><s%> therefore <S%H3651><s%> cry <S%H7769><s%> out for help <S%H7769><s%>?
"Have I not wept <S%H1058><s%> for the one whose life <S%H3117><s%> is hard <S%H7186><s%>? Was not my soul <S%H5315><s%> grieved <S%H5701><s%> for the needy <S%H34><s%>?

"When <S%H3588><s%> I expected <S%H6960><s%> good, <S%H9185><s%> then evil <S%H9563><s%> came; <S%H935><s%> When I waited <S%H3176><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> then darkness <S%H652><s%> came. <S%H935><s%>
"I am seething <S%H7570><s%> within, <S%H4578><s%> and cannot <S%H3808><s%> relax; <S%H1826><s%> Days <S%H3117><s%> of affliction <S%H6040><s%> confront <S%H6923><s%> me.
"I go <S%H1980><s%> about mourning <S%H6937><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> comfort; I stand <S%H6965><s%> up in the assembly <S%H6951><s%> [and] cry <S%H7768><s%> out for help. <S%H7768><s%>
"I have become <S%H1961><s%> a brother <S%H251><s%> to jackals, <S%H8565><s%> And a companion <S%H7453><s%> of ostriches. <S%H1323><s%> <S%H3284><s%>
"My skin <S%H5785><s%> turns <S%H7835><s%> black <S%H7835><s%> on me, And my bones <S%H6106><s%> burn <S%H2787><s%> with fever. <S%H2721><s%>
"Therefore my harp <S%H3658><s%> is turned <S%H1961><s%> to mourning, <S%H60><s%> And my flute <S%H5748><s%> to the sound <S%H6963><s%> of those who weep. <S%H1058><s%>
